channel.title: Loyalty Tilte Help
channel.description: Hey Mopar. I have added loyalty titles to players names. EG. Lord Grace123. I want to make it so its like a pvp rank system. So if player has 10 kills, loyaltyrank = 1. (lord). If player has 15 kills, loyaltyrank = 2 (sir) and so on. Could some1 help me with the code and where in the source i would place it thanks.

item.title: Loyalty Tilte Help
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

You could also use some switch fallthroughs:

switch(playerKills) { case 1: giveLoyaltyTitle1; case 10: give loyaltyTitle2; case 50: give loyaltyTitle3; break; }
Notice you only have a break on the last one (which isn’t even needed either)

EDIT - I’m a moron. While yes this code works for things like player rights (with only a few options, plus I did it backwards here), it wont work feasibly with this. Use if statements, I didn’t think this one through at all :rolleyes:

Read full topic

item.title: Loyalty Tilte Help
item.dc:creator: @omgomgomgl omgomgomgl
item.description:
@omgomgomgl wrote:

I could just give you a playerupdate class compatibly of custom titles in front on names you want?

Read full topic

item.title: Loyalty Tilte Help
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Make a variable, and make it add one to that variable every time you kill someone, in the code with your titles put something like,

if (playerKills == 0) {
loyaltyTitle == "";
} else if (playerKills == 1) {
loyaltyTitle == "";
} else {
loyaltyTitle == "";

Or how ever you set it up, I’m just giving you ideas.

Read full topic
